PyUncertainNumber.UP.cauchy_old
===============================

.. py:module:: PyUncertainNumber.UP.cauchy_old


Functions
---------

.. autoapisummary::

   PyUncertainNumber.UP.cauchy_old.cauchydeviate_method


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:function:: cauchydeviate_method(x: numpy.ndarray, f: Callable, n: int, save_raw_data='no')

   Performs uncertainty propagation using the Cauchy Deviate Method.

   :param x: A 2D NumPy array representing the intervals for each input variable.
             Each inner list or row should contain two elements:
             the lower and upper bounds of the interval.
   :param fun: A callable function that takes a 1D NumPy array of input values
               and returns a single output value or an array of output values.
   :param n: The number of samples (Cauchy deviates) to generate for each input variable.

   :returns: the estimated lower and upper bounds of the output
             interval(s), representing the range of possible output values considering
             the input uncertainties.
   :rtype: A 2D NumPy array
